alert.note: Alert for Concho (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 25 at 2:42PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Concho, Menard, Schleicher and Tom Green. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated mainly light rain showers across the area in eastern Schleicher, southeastern Tom Green, southwestern Concho, and extreme northwest Menard counties. Earlier heavy rainfall and runoff may lead to urban and small stream flooding, and some low spots may already be flooded. According to rain gauges and radar estimates, between 2 and 3 and a half inches of rain have fallen in that area today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vick, Adams, The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 2084 and The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 765. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
